jcr:content.jcr:title: She's a Park Explorer at Ichetucknee Springs State Park- CSA

data.address: 12087 SW U.S. Highway 27, Fort White, FL 32038
data.details:
She’s a Park Explorer at Ichetucknee Springs State Park - CSA
Grades: 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12

There are many challenges to protecting Florida’s fragile springs and rivers.  Our state has one of the highest concentrations of natural springs in the world, and they attract millions of people each year.  Ichetucknee Springs State Park is guardian to one of Florida’s largest spring systems—about 2,300 acres of headwaters and forests surrounded by a 250-square mile basin supplied by the Floridan Aquifer.  Park rangers use many tools to keep the springs clean and protected.  We will take a close look at some of those tools today, including taking water quality measurements and analyzing the flora and fauna of the river for potential problems.  Hands-on activities will include building a water retention model to minimize pollution impacts, water-sampling, plant identification, and sampling the river’s fish and invertebrate population to determine the health of the springs. Fun patch provided. Park entrance fee included.

*This event is for 2016 registered Girl Scouts, and registered & approved adult volunteers.
* For safety and supervision reasons, troops and individuals are not permitted to bring non-Girl Scouts or siblings. 
*Girl/adult ratios must be followed and adults are expected to stay on the premises during the event. 

$8/girl, $8/adult 
Contact: Brittany McCallister 904.389.3071
